text: spartin (spartin) encodes a multi-functional protein associated with organelle membranes, including endosomes, lipid droplets, and mitochondria. It participates in cytokinesis, BMP receptor trafficking, lipid droplet turnover, and mitochondrial Ca[2+] homeostasis.
label: Spartin is a membrane-associated protein that regulates multiple cellular processes including cytokinesis, receptor trafficking, lipid metabolism, and mitochondrial calcium balance.

text: Rab23 (Rab23) encodes a member of the Rab family of small GTPases known to be involved in vesicle transport processes. It cooperates with the product of in and the core group of planar cell polarity genes. It contributes to restricting actin accumulation and thus, prehair initiation to a single site within each wing cell, and to regulate the number and orientation of hairs on the leg and the abdominal cuticle. In addition, it regulates the trafficking of the ligand encoded by hh in the germline stem cell niche.
label: Rab23 is a small GTPase that regulates vesicle transport, planar cell polarity, and Hedgehog ligand trafficking in Drosophila.

text: Tailor (Tailor) encodes a cytoplasmic RNA-specific terminal uridylyltransferase. It acts as part of the terminal RNA uridylation-mediated processing (TRUMP) complex, marking RNA species for 3'-to-5' exoribonucleolytic decay by the product of Dis3l2. The product of Tailor regulates microRNA biogenesis by targeting precursor-microRNAs (predominantly mirtron hairpins) and targets unprocessed RNA polymerase III transcripts for degradation in a cytoplasmic RNA surveillance pathway.
label: Tailor is a terminal uridylyltransferase that marks specific RNAs (including pre-miRNAs and RNA pol III transcripts) for degradation through uridylation.

text: MAGE (MAGE) encodes a component of the SMC5/6 protein complex. This complex is critical to genome stability, and is required for homologous DNA recombination-based processes.
label: MAGE encodes a component of the SMC5/6 protein complex that maintains genome stability through DNA recombination processes.

text: pyd3 (pyd3) encodes a beta-alanine synthase involved in pyrimidine catabolism, beta-alanine biosynthesis and cuticle pigmentation.
label: Pyd3 functions as a beta-alanine synthase that breaks down pyrimidines to produce beta-alanine, which is important for cuticle pigmentation.

text: Veneno (Veneno) encodes a protein belonging to the TDRD1 family that is predicted to have a role in the piRNA pathway.
label: Veneno is involved in the piRNA pathway, which helps protect genomic stability by regulating transposable elements.

text: ranshi (ranshi) encodes a protein involved in oocyte differentiation.
label: Ranshi functions in oocyte differentiation in Drosophila.

text: beag (beag) encodes a spliceosomal protein required for normal neuromuscular junction development and function. It functions together with the product of Smu1 and can regulate the alternative mRNA splicing of Fas2.
label: Beag is a spliceosomal protein that regulates alternative mRNA splicing and is essential for proper neuromuscular junction development and function in Drosophila.

text: Fancl (Fancl) encodes a member of the Fanconi anemia pathway, which is a key mediator of DNA damage repair through homologous recombination. When mono-ubiquinated by the Fanconi core complex, it associates with the product of Fancd2 and localizes to sites of DNA damage.
label: Fancl functions as part of the Fanconi anemia pathway to facilitate DNA damage repair through homologous recombination.

text: Rrp46 (Rrp46) encodes a protein involved in gene expression regulation.
label: Rrp46 is a component of the exosome complex that processes and degrades RNA molecules.

text: Leash (Leash) encodes a member of the arrestin domain-containing protein family, which functions as an adaptor molecule for protein degradation. It inhibits growth by inducing degradation of the product of yki via the lysosomal pathway.
label: Leash functions as an adaptor protein that inhibits growth by promoting the lysosomal degradation of Yorkie (Yki) protein.

text: ninaG (ninaG) encodes a glucose-methanol-choline oxidoreductase required for the biogenesis of the rhodopsin chromophore (3S)-3-hydroxyretinal, likely by stimulating conversion between the two enantiomers of 3-hydroxyretinal.
label: ninaG encodes an oxidoreductase enzyme that helps produce the visual pigment chromophore in Drosophila eyes by converting between forms of 3-hydroxyretinal.

text: Spt3 (Spt3) encodes a encodes a subunit of the SAGA chromatin modifying complex.
label: Spt3 functions as part of the SAGA complex to modify chromatin structure and regulate transcription.

text: MBD-R2 (MBD-R2) encodes a Zinc finger C2H2 transcription factor. It is a component of nonspecific lethal (NSL) complex involved in transcriptional activation.
label: MBD-R2 is a transcription factor that functions as part of the NSL complex to activate gene transcription.

text: Tim17a1 (Tim17a1) encodes a subunit of the TIM23 complex, which is a presequence translocase responsible for transporting proteins across the inner mitochondrial membrane. It modulates the gating of the transmembrane channel of TIM23 and plays a role in both matrix translocation as well as lateral membrane sorting.
label: Tim17a1 is a component of the mitochondrial TIM23 complex that helps transport proteins across the inner mitochondrial membrane.

text: timeout (timeout) encodes a role in the maintenance of chromosome integrity and in the light synchronization of the adult circadian clock
label: Timeout functions in maintaining chromosome integrity and synchronizing the circadian clock in response to light in Drosophila.

text: Rrp6 (Rrp6) encodes an exoribonuclease that forms part of the RNA processing exosome complex. It is involved in the regulation of cell cycle progresion and mRNA surveillance.
label: Rrp6 is an exoribonuclease that functions in RNA processing and degradation as part of the exosome complex to regulate cell cycle and mRNA quality control.

text: GATAe (GATAe) encodes a endoderm-specific GATA factor. It regulates endoderm differentiation and intestinal stem cell maintenance.
label: GATAe is a transcription factor that controls endoderm development and maintains intestinal stem cells in Drosophila.

text: Keap1 (Keap1) encodes a protein that interacts with the product of cnc to regulate the activation of genes by oxidative stress.
label: Keap1 regulates oxidative stress response genes through interaction with the Cnc protein.

text: subdued (subdued) encodes a chloride ion channel activated by calcium and heat belonging to the TMEM16 family. Its roles include host defense against ingested pathogenic bacteria and modulation of sensory neuronal signaling.
label: Subdued is a calcium/heat-activated chloride channel that functions in bacterial defense and sensory neuron signaling.

text: ETHR (ETHR) encodes two distinct G protein-coupled receptors through alternative splicing. During development, the receptors are essential in initiating the molt-related behaviors of ecdysis, and in adults they function to promote juvenile hormone signaling and reproduction.
label: ETHR encodes G protein-coupled receptors that regulate molting behavior, juvenile hormone signaling, and reproduction in Drosophila.

text: p53 (p53) encodes a transcriptional factor required for adaptive responses to genotoxic stress, including cell death, compensatory proliferation and DNA repair.
label: p53 is a transcription factor that regulates cellular responses to DNA damage, including apoptosis, cell proliferation, and DNA repair mechanisms.

text: Dis3 (Dis3) encodes an exoribonuclease that forms part of the RNA processing exosome complex. It is involved in the regulation of cell cycle progresion, microRNA expression and mRNA surveillance.
label: Dis3 is an exoribonuclease that functions as part of the RNA exosome complex to process and degrade various RNA species.

text: polybromo (polybromo) encodes a subunit of Polybromo-associated Brahma complex (PBAP). Its main biological role is involved in chromatin remodeling together with Brahma complex. It can also regulate gene transcription through DNA binding, which is dependent or independent ofthe PBAP complex.
label: Polybromo functions as a chromatin remodeling factor as part of the PBAP complex to regulate gene transcription in Drosophila.

text: sosie (sosie) encodes a protein that localizes to the plasma membrane in the germ line and the follicle cells during oogenesis. It interacts with the products of kst, jbug and chic, and helps localizing the product of kst and Actins.
label: Sosie is a plasma membrane protein that helps localize actin and other proteins during Drosophila oogenesis.

text: Smg6 (Smg6) encodes an RNA endonuclease that is required for nonsense mediated mRNA decay (NMD). Upon recognition of an NMD-targeted transcript, it cleaves the mRNA in the vicinity of the termination codon, exposing free 5' and 3' ends leading to the complete exonucleolytic degradation of the target.
label: Smg6 is an RNA endonuclease that degrades aberrant mRNAs through nonsense-mediated decay by cleaving them near termination codons.

text: veli (veli) encodes a protein involved in border follicle cell migration and regulation of synaptic growth at the neuromuscular junction.
label: Veli functions in border follicle cell migration and regulates synaptic growth at neuromuscular junctions in Drosophila.

text: shams (shams) encodes an endoplasmic reticulum protein xylosyltransferase that catalyzes the attachment of alpha-D-xylose to O-glucosylated EGF-like repeats of selected membrane and secreted proteins. O-linked glucosylation of the N protein plays an important role in the modulation of the N signalling pathway.
label: Shams is an ER xylosyltransferase that modifies EGF-like repeats on proteins through O-linked glycosylation, which helps regulate Notch signaling.

text: XNP (XNP) encodes two protein isoforms that participate in the maintenance of heterochromatin and chromosomal stability. They interact with heterochromatin proteins such as those encoded by Su(var)205 and ADD1.
label: XNP functions in maintaining heterochromatin structure and chromosomal stability through interactions with heterochromatin proteins.

text: Sld5 (Sld5) encodes a subunit of the Cdc45/Mcm2-7/GINS (CMG) complex, which is associated with an ATP-dependent DNA helicase function and is involved in the regulation of the mitotic G1/S transition.
label: Sld5 encodes a component of the CMG helicase complex essential for DNA replication during cell division.

text: plum (plum) encodes an Ig-superfamily transmembrane protein. It is required for developmental pruning of both mushroom body neurons and motor neurons via TGF-beta signaling. plum genetically interacts with myo and babo.
label: Plum is a transmembrane protein required for developmental pruning of mushroom body and motor neurons through TGF-beta signaling.

text: bigmax (bigmax) encodes a basic helix-loop-helix-leucine zipper transcription factor. Together with its binding partner encoded by Mondo, the product of bigmax is involved in sugar-dependent gene regulation. It is involved in transcriptional control of many metabolic pathways, including glycolysis, de novo lipogenesis and the pentose phosphate pathway. Loss of bigmax function produces dietary sugar intolerance.
label: Bigmax is a transcription factor that partners with Mondo to regulate sugar-dependent metabolic genes in Drosophila.

text: Tusp (Tusp) encodes a protein involved in SNARE complex assembly.
label: Tusp functions in SNARE complex assembly, which is important for membrane fusion and vesicle trafficking.

text: BCAS2 (BCAS2) encodes an essential protein that regulates wing development via Delta-Notch signaling.
label: BCAS2 is essential for wing development in Drosophila through regulation of Delta-Notch signaling.

text: Moca-cyp (Moca-cyp) encodes a peptidyl-prolyl cis-trans isomerase.
label: Moca-cyp encodes a peptidyl-prolyl cis-trans isomerase that catalyzes protein folding by isomerizing peptide bonds at proline residues.

text: Diedel (Diedel) encodes a small extracellular immunomodulatory cytokine, which down-regulates the immune deficiency pathway of host defense. Some insect DNA viruses encode proteins homologous to the product of Diedel.
label: Diedel encodes a cytokine that suppresses the immune response in Drosophila by downregulating the immune deficiency pathway.

text: Tace (Tace) encodes a transmembrane anchored, cell surface metalloprotease and member of the ADAM family of proteins. The product of Tace, along with the related ADAM protease encoded by kuz, performs ectodomain shedding by cleaving cell surface receptors and/or ligands to affect cell-cell signaling or adhesion. Both proteases are implicated in the Notch signaling pathway.
label: Tace encodes a metalloprotease that regulates cell signaling and adhesion through ectodomain shedding of cell surface proteins, particularly in the Notch pathway.

text: Asator (Asator) encodes a tau-tubulin kinase homolog that is localized to the cytoplasm at interphase. It directly interacts with the spindle matrix protein encoded by Mgtor and localizes to the spindle region during mitosis.
label: Asator is a tau-tubulin kinase that interacts with spindle matrix proteins and plays a role in mitotic spindle organization during cell division.

text: Sox102F (Sox102F) encodes a transcription factor in the Sox gene family that regulates the Wnt signaling pathway. Its roles include heart development and cardiac function, and wing vein development and patterning.
label: Sox102F is a transcription factor that regulates Wnt signaling to control heart and wing development in Drosophila.

text: p115 (p115) encodes a key protein of the early secretory pathway where it interacts with the product of GM130 and Rab proteins. p115 depletion from S2 cells leads to a fragmentation of the Golgi but without impairing transport efficiency.
label: p115 is a protein involved in maintaining Golgi structure and function in the early secretory pathway through interactions with GM130 and Rab proteins.

text: lectin-46Cb (lectin-46Cb) encodes a protein with homology to C-type lectins. It is produced in the male accessory gland and transferred to females during mating. In mated females, is required for the binding of product of SP to sperm, and for maintenance of long-term post-mating responses.
label: Lectin-46Cb is a C-type lectin protein produced in male accessory glands that helps bind sex peptide to sperm in mated females, enabling long-term post-mating responses.

text: lectin-46Ca (lectin-46Ca) encodes a protein with homology to C-type lectins. It is produced in the male accessory gland and transferred to females during mating. In mated females, it binds to sperm in the seminal receptacle. It is required for the binding of the product of SP to sperm, and for maintenance of long-term post-mating responses.
label: Lectin-46Ca is a C-type lectin protein produced in male accessory glands that enables sperm binding and long-term post-mating responses in female Drosophila.

text: lectin-24Db (lectin-24Db) encodes a protein that interacts specifically with fucose and mannose.
label: Lectin-24Db encodes a carbohydrate-binding protein (lectin) that specifically recognizes and binds to fucose and mannose sugars.

text: HGTX (HGTX) encodes a homeodomain transcription factor that acts in parallel with the product of exex to promote the development and differentiation of motor neurons that innervate ventral body wall muscles. Its major roles include neuronal specification and differentiation.
label: HGTX is a homeodomain transcription factor that promotes motor neuron development and differentiation, particularly for neurons innervating ventral body wall muscles in Drosophila.

text: Ephrin (Ephrin) encodes the ligand of the product of Eph. It is involved in nervous system development.
label: Ephrin functions as a ligand for the Eph receptor and plays a role in nervous system development.

text: Seipin (Seipin) encodes a transmembrane protein with roles in ER calcium homeostasis and lipid storage.
label: Seipin is a transmembrane protein that regulates endoplasmic reticulum calcium levels and lipid storage in cells.

text: mus81 (mus81) encodes the catalytic subunit of the Mus81-mms4 structure-selective endonuclease that functions in DNA repair.
label: Mus81 is a structure-selective endonuclease that repairs DNA damage as part of the Mus81-mms4 complex.

text: G9a (G9a) encodes a histone-lysine methyltransferase involved in epigenetic regulation. It contributes to multiple processes including gene expression, dendrite morphogenesis, larval locomotory behavior as well as short and long-term memory.
label: G9a is a histone methyltransferase that regulates gene expression and various neurological functions through epigenetic modification.

text: Buffy (Buffy) encodes one of the two Bcl-2 family members in Drosophila (the other being the product of Debcl). Its loss has been linked to altered energy metabolism in larvae.
label: Buffy is a Bcl-2 family protein that regulates energy metabolism and cell death in Drosophila.

text: Prosap (Prosap) encodes a member of SH3 and multiple ankyrin repeat domain (SHANK) family of genes that encode synaptic scaffolding proteins. It regulates synaptic growth and development, including the structure of the neuromuscular junction and synapses of the calyx, and olfactory acuity.
label: Prosap encodes a synaptic scaffolding protein that regulates synaptic growth and development in Drosophila.

text: schlank (schlank) encodes a member of the Ceramide Synthases family involved in sphingolipid metabolism. It is essential for ceramide synthesis and modulates triacylglycerol levels and transcriptional expression of body fat metabolism regulators.
label: Schlank is a ceramide synthase that regulates sphingolipid metabolism and body fat homeostasis in Drosophila.

text: tamo (tamo) encodes a protein with an essential function during oogenesis where it interacts with the product of dl and proteins that are part of the nuclear import machinery.
label: Tamo functions in oogenesis by interacting with dorsal and nuclear import proteins.

text: olf186-F (olf186-F) encodes a plasma membrane localised protein that functions as a pore subunit of the store-operated calcium entry (SOCE) channel.
label: Olf186-F functions as a pore-forming component of store-operated calcium channels that regulate calcium entry into cells.

text: Ku80 (Ku80) encodes a protein that forms a Ku heterodimer with the product of Irbp, which binds to DNA double-strand break ends and is required for the non-homologous end joining pathway of DNA repair.
label: Ku80 forms part of a protein complex that binds to broken DNA ends and facilitates repair through non-homologous end joining.

text: 7B2 (7B2) encodes a peptidase required for the zymogen conversion and secretion of the prohormone convertase 2 encoded by amon.
label: 7B2 encodes a peptidase that helps activate and secrete prohormone convertase 2.

text: SCAR (SCAR) encodes a primary regulator of the Arp2/3 complex, which promotes actin polymerization and influences cell shape and motility. It is involved in myoblast fusion, eye morphogenesis and axogenesis.
label: SCAR regulates actin polymerization through the Arp2/3 complex to control cell shape, movement, and development in processes like myoblast fusion and axon growth.

text: HBS1 (HBS1) encodes an elongation factor class G protein that is implicated in messenger RNA quality control, by forming a protein complex with the product of pelo to promote decay of mRNAs with ribosomal stalls.
label: HBS1 is an elongation factor protein that works with pelo to facilitate decay of stalled mRNAs as part of quality control.

text: Notum (Notum) encodes an enzyme that cleaves glycophosphatidylinositol anchors. It acts via the product of dlp to influence the range and activity of secreted signaling proteins that interact with proteoglycans in the imaginal discs.
label: Notum encodes an enzyme that regulates signaling protein activity by cleaving glycophosphatidylinositol anchors from proteoglycans in Drosophila imaginal discs.

text: Pmi (Pmi) encodes a ubiquitous protein of the mitochondrial inner membrane that negatively controls the biogenesis of cristae membrane. Pmi-dependent cristae alterations are associated with impaired oxidative metabolism, abnormal mitochondrial shape/size, defective mitochondrial transport in neurons, and lead to stress-induced paralysis in adult flies.
label: Pmi is a mitochondrial inner membrane protein that negatively regulates cristae membrane formation, affecting mitochondrial structure and function.

text: Pak3 (Pak3) encodes a Ser/Thr kinase implicated in myoblast fusion, synapse development, wound healing and border cell migration. It functions downstream of the small Rac GTPases to regulate actin cytoskeletal organization.
label: Pak3 is a serine/threonine kinase that regulates actin cytoskeleton organization downstream of Rac GTPases to control multiple developmental processes including myoblast fusion, synapse formation, wound healing, and cell migration.

text: vig2 (vig2) encodes a protein involved in heterochromatin organization, histone H3-K9 methylation and chromatin silencing regulation.
label: Vig2 functions in heterochromatin organization and chromatin silencing through regulation of histone H3-K9 methylation.

text: Liprin-alpha (Liprin-alpha) encodes a scaffolding protein that interacts with the receptor phosphatase Lar. It is involved in synapse morphogenesis and axon guidance.
label: Liprin-alpha is a scaffolding protein that regulates synapse development and axon guidance through interaction with the Lar receptor phosphatase.

text: BG642312 (BG642312) encodes a peptide produced in the male accessory glands and transferred to females during mating.
label: BG642312 is a male accessory gland protein that is transferred to females during mating in Drosophila.

text: qless (qless) encodes a catalytic subunit of the mitochondrial prenyl diphosphate synthase complex that sequentially transfers isopentenyl diphosphate to farnesyl diphosphate to produce all-trans-polyprenyl diphosphate of varying chain length. It catalyzes the first step in the synthesis of the isoprenoid side chain of Coenzyme Q (ubiquinone), a lipid component of the mitochondrial electron transport chain.
label: Qless is essential for Coenzyme Q synthesis by catalyzing the formation of polyprenyl diphosphate chains needed for the mitochondrial electron transport chain.

text: Jupiter (Jupiter) encodes a microtubule-associated protein. Jupiter-labeled microtubules move through the nurse cell-oocyte ring canals in stage 9 egg chambers.
label: Jupiter encodes a microtubule-associated protein that facilitates microtubule movement through ring canals between nurse cells and oocytes during Drosophila egg chamber development.

text: Nnf1b (Nnf1b) encodes a component of the Mis12 complex, which is an essential constituent of the kinetochore.
label: Nnf1b encodes a kinetochore protein that functions as part of the Mis12 complex during cell division.

text: smog (smog) encodes a G-protein-coupled receptor with a key role in gastrulation. It contributes to cell intercalation and apical constriction via myosin II activation.
label: Smog is a G-protein-coupled receptor that regulates cell movements during gastrulation through myosin II-mediated cell shape changes.

text: saturn (saturn) is a newly evolved gene that encodes a predicted disordered protein with no homology to other known proteins. Males with reduced saturn expression are near-sterile, showing low sperm production and no sperm storage in mated females.
label: Saturn is required for male fertility in Drosophila, specifically for proper sperm production and storage in females.

text: meru (meru) encodes a scaffold protein belonging to the N-terminal RASSF (Ras-association domain family) protein family. It is expressed in sensory organ precursor cells, where it promotes the planar polarization of the polarity protein encoded by baz.
label: Meru is a scaffold protein that promotes planar polarization of Bazooka in sensory organ precursor cells.

text: Claspin (Claspin) encodes a nuclear protein that is involved in the ATR-Chk1 checkpoint pathway. It is required for the cell cycle checkpoint induced at midblastula transition.
label: Claspin is a nuclear protein that functions in the ATR-Chk1 cell cycle checkpoint pathway and is required for checkpoint activation during midblastula transition.

text: zormin (zormin) encodes a protein found in the Z-disc and the M-line of muscles. It probably has a structural function.
label: Zormin is a structural protein found in muscle Z-discs and M-lines in Drosophila.

text: sphinx2 (sphinx2) encodes a protein related to the serine protease homolog, which is strongly expressed in the male accessory gland.
label: Sphinx2 is a serine protease homolog expressed in male accessory glands of Drosophila.

text: sphinx1 (sphinx1) encodes a protein related to the serine protease homolog, which is strongly expressed in the male accessory gland.
label: Sphinx1 is a serine protease homolog expressed in male accessory glands of Drosophila.

text: parvin (parvin) encodes a Calponin-homology protein that, together with the products of Ilk and stck, reinforces integrin-matrix adhesion at muscle attachment sites in the developing embryo. The product of parvin contributes to cell adhesion and actin cytoskeleton organisation in muscles, wing and eye epithelial cells.
label: Parvin is a Calponin-homology protein that strengthens integrin-matrix adhesion and organizes the actin cytoskeleton in muscle and epithelial cells.

text: His4:CG33901 (His4:CG33901) encodes a histone H4 replacement variant that is part of the nucleosome core. It is the predominant histone H4 in non-dividing cells. Its amino acid sequence is identical to the cell-cycle regulated histone encoded by His4.
label: His4:CG33901 encodes a histone H4 variant that forms part of the nucleosome core in non-dividing cells.

text: Zwilch (Zwilch) encodes a subunit of the RZZ complex located at the kinetochores of chromosomes. The RZZ complex plays an essential role in the spindle assembly checkpoint that ensures proper connections between chromosomes and the mitotic spindle.
label: Zwilch encodes a kinetochore protein that helps ensure proper chromosome segregation during cell division through its role in the spindle assembly checkpoint.

text: Lasp (Lasp) encodes a member of the nebulin family. It plays subtle roles in modulating the actin cytoskeleton in ovaries, testes, and muscles, by serving as a scaffold protein binding multiple partners, especially actin and myosin. In indirect flight muscles, it contributes to I-band and A-band architecture.
label: Lasp functions as a scaffold protein that modulates the actin cytoskeleton in reproductive organs and muscles by binding to actin, myosin, and other partners.

text: Patj (Patj) encodes a PDZ domain-protein that forms an apical protein complex with the products of crb and sdt. It plays supporting roles in apico-basal cell polarity and stability of adherens junction. It is also involved in retinal morphogenesis, maintenance, and planar cell polarity.
label: Patj is a PDZ domain-protein that helps establish and maintain cell polarity and junction stability through interactions with other apical complex proteins.

text: Porin2 (Porin2) encodes a protein with voltage-independent cation-selective pore activity that is involved in ion transport.
label: Porin2 functions as a voltage-independent cation channel that facilitates ion transport across membranes.

text: inaF-C (inaF-C) encodes one of the four isoforms at the InaF locus, which contains four small ORFs named inaF-A, inaF-B, inaF-C, and inaF-D, each of which is spliced to the same down-stream exon. Mutations in inaF-C and inaF-B greatly suppress the expression of photoreceptor channel protein trp. inaF-C and inaF-B co-immunolocalize with trp to the rhabdomeres, structures containing the photoreceptors.
label: inaF-C regulates the expression and localization of the TRP photoreceptor channel protein in Drosophila rhabdomeres, which is essential for proper visual function.

text: inaF-A (inaF-A) encodes one of the four isoforms at the InaF locus, which contains four small ORFs named inaF-A, inaF-B, inaF-C, and inaF-D, each of which is spliced to the same down-stream exon. inaF-A is involved in the response to light stimulus.
label: inaF-A functions in light response pathways in Drosophila.

text: natalisin (natalisin) encodes five signaling peptides with potent agonist activities toward the product of TkR86C.
label: Natalisin produces signaling peptides that activate the TkR86C receptor.

text: Not1 (Not1) encodes a poly(A)-specific ribonuclease involved in translation inhibition and ovarian follicle cell development.
label: Not1 is a ribonuclease that regulates translation and is required for proper ovarian follicle cell development in Drosophila.

text: rumi (rumi) encodes an endoplasmic reticulum protein O-glucosyltransferase with dual specificity that catalyzes the attachment of alpha-D-glucose and alpha-D-xylose, via a beta-glycosidic bond, to the hydroxyl group of serine residues in EGF-like repeats of selected membrane or secreted proteins. It modulates the Notch signaling pathway and seems to regulate the function of other proteins, including the product of eys.
label: Rumi is an O-glucosyltransferase that modifies EGF-like repeats on proteins in the endoplasmic reticulum, primarily affecting Notch signaling.

text: Invadolysin (Invadolysin) encodes a metalloprotease that is required for mitosis, cell migration and mitochondrial function.
label: Invadolysin is a metalloprotease enzyme that plays essential roles in mitosis, cell migration, and mitochondrial function.

text: spn-F (spn-F) encodes a coiled-coil protein that forms part of the IKKepsilon-jvl complex. Its roles include actin and microtubule organization during oocyte development and bristle growth.
label: spn-F is a coiled-coil protein that regulates cytoskeletal organization during Drosophila oocyte development and bristle formation.

text: Spf45 (Spf45) encodes a bi-functional protein with roles in both splicing and DNA repair.
label: Spf45 functions as a protein involved in both pre-mRNA splicing and DNA repair mechanisms.

text: Bre1 (Bre1) encodes an E3 ubiquitin ligase that interacts with the E2 ubiquitin ligase encoded by Ubc6 to direct ubiquitination of histone H2B on lysine 120 at most RNA Polymerase II transcribed  genes. It regulates Notch signaling.
label: Bre1 is an E3 ubiquitin ligase that ubiquitinates histone H2B to regulate gene transcription and Notch signaling.

text: Spc25 (Spc25) encodes a component of the Ndc80 complex, which is an essential kinetochore constituent.
label: Spc25 is a kinetochore protein that functions as part of the Ndc80 complex to help ensure proper chromosome segregation during cell division.

text: eater (eater) encodes a transmembrane receptor of the Nimrod family specifically expressed in hemocytes and required for the phagocytosis of Gram positive bacteria and the attachment of hemocytes to sessile niches.
label: Eater is a transmembrane receptor expressed in hemocytes that mediates phagocytosis of Gram-positive bacteria and helps hemocytes attach to sessile niches.

text: BG642167 (BG642167) encodes a peptide produced by the male accessory glands and is predicted to be secreted.
label: BG642167 is a male accessory gland protein that produces a secreted peptide in Drosophila.

text: futsch (futsch) encodes a microtubule binding protein involved in the formation of synaptic buttons at the neuromuscular junctions. Its expression levels are regulated by the product of TBPH to prevent synaptic defects.
label: Futsch is a microtubule binding protein that regulates synaptic button formation at neuromuscular junctions in Drosophila.

text: Nedd4 (Nedd4) encodes an E3 ubiquitin ligase that negatively regulates the Notch signaling pathway and the genes comm, Amph. It contributes to neuromuscular synaptogenesis, transverse tubule formation in muscles, and in muscle function.
label: Nedd4 is an E3 ubiquitin ligase that regulates neuromuscular development and function through protein degradation and Notch pathway modulation.

text: Mob2 (Mob2) encodes a protein that belongs to the Mob1/phocein domain protein family. Its functions include rhabdomere determination during photoreceptor development.
label: Mob2 is involved in determining rhabdomere development in Drosophila photoreceptors.

text: Jabba (Jabba) encodes a lipid droplet protein that sequesters histones on lipid droplets. It promotes proper development of pre-cellular embryos, controls levels of nuclear histones, and mediates anti-bacterial protection.
label: Jabba is a lipid droplet protein that stores and regulates histones on lipid droplets, which is essential for proper embryo development and histone homeostasis.

text: wech (wech) encodes a member of the RBCC/TRIM family of cytoplasmic multidomain proteins. It is a regulator of integrin-mediated adhesion. It interacts with the products of rhea and Ilk, which are components of the integrin-cytoskeleton link.
label: Wech is a cytoplasmic protein that regulates integrin-mediated cell adhesion by interacting with components of the integrin-cytoskeleton link.

text: loopin-1 (loopin-1) encodes a testis-specific protein with homology to several leucine aminopeptidases. Sequence analysis suggest that it doesn't have enzymatic activity. It accumulates inside the axoneme-associated mitochondrial derivative in mature sperms.
label: Loopin-1 is a testis-specific protein that localizes to mitochondrial derivatives in mature Drosophila sperm.

text: inaF-B (inaF-B) encodes one of the four isoforms at the InaF locus, which contains four small ORFs named inaF-A, inaF-B, inaF-C, and inaF-D, each of which is spliced to the same down-stream exon. Mutations in inaF-B and inaF-C greatly suppress the expression of photoreceptor channel protein trp. inaF-B and inaF-C co-immunolocalize with trp to the rhabdomeres, structures containing the photoreceptors.
label: inaF-B regulates the expression and localization of the TRP photoreceptor channel protein in Drosophila rhabdomeres, which is essential for proper visual function.

text: nab (nab) encodes a transcriptional co-factor that acts in combination with the transcriptional factors encoded by rn in proximal-distal wing patterning and the product of sqz in CNS development.
label: Nab functions as a transcriptional co-factor that regulates wing patterning and CNS development by interacting with specific transcription factors.

text: rhea (rhea) encodes fly talin, a large adaptor protein that is essential for all adhesive functions of integrins. It also has at least one role independent of integrins: repressing shg transcription in follicle cells.
label: Rhea encodes talin, a protein that mediates integrin-based cell adhesion and regulates shg transcription in Drosophila.

text: 2mit (2mit) encodes a putative leucine-rich repeat transmembrane protein that is mainly expressed in the developing central nervous system. In the adult, it has a role in short-term memory.
label: 2mit is a transmembrane protein involved in short-term memory formation in Drosophila.

text: inaF-D (inaF-D) encodes one of the four isoforms at the InaF locus, which contains four small ORFs named inaF-A, inaF-B, inaF-C, and inaF-D, each of which is spliced to the same down-stream exon. Contrary to the other isoforms, the biological role of inaF-D is poorly understood.
label: The biological function of inaF-D in Drosophila is not well understood, as it is one of four isoforms at the InaF locus that share a common downstream exon.

text: par-1 (par-1) encodes a protein kinase involved in multiple processes, including microtubule cytoskeleton organization, axis specification and cell polarity. It regulates hippo signaling and osk mRNA localization.
label: Par-1 is a protein kinase that regulates cell polarity, cytoskeletal organization, and axis specification through phosphorylation of target proteins.

text: Baldspot (Baldspot) encodes a protein involved in spermatogenesis.
label: Baldspot functions in spermatogenesis in Drosophila.

text: Xrp1 (Xrp1) encodes an AT-Hook, bZip DNA binding protein involved in genome stability maintenance. It heterodimerizes with the product of Irbp18 to bind to P element sequences  ng to transposition. It is induced by p53 following X-irradiation and by mutations or knockdown of caz or ribosomal protein (Rp) encoding genes. It contributes to the slow growth of Minute (Rp+/-) mutants cell-autonomously by inhibiting translation and non-autonomously through regulation of the product of Ilp8.
label: Xrp1 is a DNA-binding protein that regulates genome stability, cellular growth, and translation in response to various cellular stresses including radiation damage and ribosomal protein deficiencies.

text: nero (nero) encodes a deoxyhypusine hydroxylase enzyme that is required for the hypusination of eEF5 and is localized to the endoplasmic reticulum. It negatively regulates autophagy.
label: Nero is a deoxyhypusine hydroxylase that modifies eEF5 through hypusination and negatively regulates autophagy.

text: nbs (nbs) encodes a component of the conserved MRN complex, which plays an important role in the repair of DNA double strand breaks. The product of nbs is required to prevent chromosome breakage, interacts with the telomere capping complex and prevents telomeric fusions.
label: Nbs is part of the MRN complex that repairs DNA double strand breaks and maintains telomere integrity to prevent chromosome damage.

text: Thor (Thor) encodes a eukaryotic translation initiation factor 4E binding protein that is controlled by the product of tor. It contributes to translation regulation, response to environmental stress and cell growth regulation.
label: Thor functions as a translational repressor by binding to eIF4E, regulating cell growth and stress responses downstream of TOR signaling.

text: CoRest (CoRest) encodes a DNA binding factor that controls transcription in cooperation with other transcriptional regulators. It positively modulates Notch signaling as well as showing co-repressor activity via histone modification regulation.
label: CoRest is a transcriptional regulator that functions as both a co-activator of Notch signaling and a co-repressor through histone modifications.

text: tweek (tweek) encodes a protein involved in the endocytosis of synaptic vesicles.
label: Tweek functions in synaptic vesicle endocytosis in Drosophila neurons.

text: Dbx (Dbx) encodes a homedomain transcription factor expressed in distinct subsets of interneurons. It helps control the differentiation of these neurons, which tend to extend short axons and be GABA-ergic, via cross-repressive interactions with the products of exex and eve. The roles of the product of Dbx include neuronal specification and differentiation.
label: Dbx is a homeodomain transcription factor that controls the differentiation and specification of GABAergic interneurons through repressive interactions with other transcription factors.

text: pico (pico) encodes an intracellular adapter protein belonging to the MRL family of proteins, which transduce signals from growth factor receptors to changes in the actin cytoskeleton. Its roles include the regulation of growth and cell migration.
label: Pico functions as an adapter protein that mediates signals from growth factor receptors to regulate actin cytoskeleton organization, cell growth, and migration.

text: osa (osa) encodes a subunit of the BAP chromatin remodeling complex. It antagonizes Wnt target gene expression and limits the self-renewal of neural and intestinal stem cells.
label: Osa is a chromatin remodeling complex subunit that regulates stem cell self-renewal by suppressing Wnt signaling targets.

text: dikar (dikar) encodes a protein involved in long-term memory.
label: Dikar functions in long-term memory formation in Drosophila.

text: dachs (dachs) encodes a myosin family protein that participates in Dachsous-Fat signaling, which polarizes its localization. It influences planar cell polarity, partly through interaction with the product of pk, and growth, through interaction with the product of wts.
label: Dachs is a myosin protein that mediates Dachsous-Fat signaling to regulate planar cell polarity and tissue growth in Drosophila.

text: magu (magu) encodes a secreted protein that binds glypicans and regulates BMP signaling. It contributes to the regulation of growth and patterning of the wing, germ-line stem cell maintenance and adult life span.
label: Magu is a secreted protein that regulates BMP signaling through glypican binding to control tissue growth, stem cell maintenance, and lifespan in Drosophila.

text: Rab8 (Rab8) encodes a member of the Rab GTPase family that regulates the function of the recycling endosome, where it localizes.
label: Rab8 is a GTPase that regulates recycling endosome function and localization.

text: Mi-2 (Mi-2) encodes a nuclear ATP-dependent nucleosome remodeler of the CHD family. It associates with active chromatin and utilizes the energy of ATP hydrolysis to move nucleosomes along DNA. It is required for repression of cell type-specific genes, full activation of heat shock genes and regulates higher order chromatin structure of polytene chromosomes.
label: Mi-2 is an ATP-dependent nucleosome remodeling protein that regulates gene expression through chromatin modification and restructuring.

text: Myc (Myc) encodes a transcription factor that is homologous to vertebrate Myc proto-oncogenes. It contributes to cell growth, cell competition and regenerative proliferation.
label: Myc is a transcription factor that regulates cell growth, competition, and regenerative proliferation in Drosophila.

text: lute (lute) encodes a protein involved in neurogenesis.
label: Lute functions in neurogenesis in Drosophila.

text: Mitf (Mitf) encodes a b-HLH-Zip transcription factor that regulates basic cellular processes in part by controlling the expression of the vacuolar (H[+])-ATPase subunits.
label: Mitf is a transcription factor that regulates cellular processes by controlling V-ATPase subunit expression.

text: Patronin (Patronin) encodes a microtubule minus-end binding protein that can promote acentrosomal nucleation of microtubules. Apical localisation of the Patronin product orients microtubules in polarised epithelial cells and in oocytes.
label: Patronin is a microtubule minus-end binding protein that regulates microtubule organization and orientation in polarized cells.

text: lost (lost) encodes a protein that interacts with the RNA-binding protein encoded by rump for posterior localization of mRNAs by diffusion/entrapment during late stages of oogenesis. The identification of the product of lost in various RNP complexes suggests a broad role in RNA metabolism.
label: Lost functions in RNA metabolism and posterior mRNA localization during Drosophila oogenesis through interactions with RNA-binding proteins.

text: ebi (ebi) encodes a nuclear-localized protein that regulates Egfr, Notch and Wg signaling pathways. ebi encoded product contributes to multiple processes including wing growth and eye development as well as regulation of transcription and innate immune response.
label: ebi encodes a nuclear protein that regulates multiple signaling pathways (Egfr, Notch, and Wg) involved in development and immune response.

text: qin (qin) is a piRNA pathway gene that encodes a protein involved in posttranscriptional gene silencing.
label: Qin functions in the piRNA pathway to regulate gene silencing at the posttranscriptional level.

text: Fife (Fife) encodes a synaptic scaffolding protein that promotes neurotransmitter release and normal motor behavior.
label: Fife is a synaptic scaffolding protein that facilitates neurotransmitter release at synapses and supports proper motor function.

text: Lst8 (Lst8) encodes a conserved TOR-binding protein that may be required for Crtc-dependent regulation of cell growth based on genetic evidence.
label: Lst8 is a TOR-binding protein involved in regulating cell growth through the TOR signaling pathway.

text: Meltrin (Meltrin) encodes an ADAM protein that belongs to the metzincin superfamily of metalloproteases. It is regulated by the homeobox protein encoded by vnd during embryonic development.
label: Meltrin encodes a metalloprotease ADAM protein that is regulated by vnd during Drosophila embryonic development.

text: rudhira (rudhira) is expressed in nephrocytes and encodes a protein that regulates macromolecular uptake and clearance by nephrocytes to maintain tissue homeostasis.
label: Rudhira regulates macromolecular uptake and clearance in nephrocytes to maintain tissue homeostasis.

text: tau (tau) encodes a microtubule associated protein, which is a specific marker for posterior signalling center cells, a subtype of immune cells. Its human ortholog is well known for its role in the stabilisation of the neuronal cytoskeleton and implication in diverse neuronal diseases, including Alzheimer's disease, where the accumulation of tau protein causes neuronal decay.
label: Tau encodes a microtubule-associated protein that functions as a marker for posterior signaling center immune cells and helps stabilize the cytoskeleton.

text: hog (hog) encodes a short protein required for centripetal follicle cell migration and eggshell formation. It may play a role in modulating transcriptional fidelity in the early embryo.
label: Hog is required for proper follicle cell migration during egg development and eggshell formation in Drosophila.

text: JYalpha (JYalpha) is a gene essential for male fertility as mutants produce immotile sperm.
label: JYalpha is essential for sperm motility in male Drosophila.

text: Yeti (Yeti) encodes an essential chromatin protein that interacts with subunits of the Tip60 chromatin remodeling complex. Yeti loss results in lethality at the larval stage and in chromosome organization defects.
label: Yeti is an essential chromatin protein that regulates chromosome organization through interactions with the Tip60 chromatin remodeling complex.

text: corolla (corolla) encodes a protein phosphatase 1 binding protein involved in centromere clustering and meiotic nuclear division.
label: Corolla is a protein phosphatase 1 binding protein that regulates centromere clustering and meiotic nuclear division in Drosophila.

text: vilya (vilya) encodes a meiosis-specific ring-domain-containing protein that is required for programmed meiotic double-strand break formation. It also functions as a component of the recombination nodule.
label: Vilya is a meiosis-specific protein that facilitates double-strand break formation and functions in recombination nodules during meiosis.

text: prage (prage) encodes a protein involved in maternal mRNA destabilization during the maternal/zygotic transition in embryonic development.
label: Prage functions in degrading maternal mRNAs during the maternal-to-zygotic transition in Drosophila embryo development.

text: Rab1 (Rab1) encodes a small GTPase which regulates endoplasmic reticulum to Golgi and intra Golgi trafficking through different effectors. It has been involved in Notch signaling, cell migration, autophagy and cytokinesis.
label: Rab1 is a small GTPase that regulates protein trafficking between the endoplasmic reticulum and Golgi apparatus.

text: xmas (xmas) encodes encodes a hydrophilic protein that is involved in spermatogenesis, oogenesis and embryogenesis.
label: Xmas is a hydrophilic protein required for proper gametogenesis and embryonic development in Drosophila.

text: speck (speck) encodes an important enzyme of the melatonin production pathway. It converts serotonin to N-acetylserotonin to regulate melatonin daily cycles.
label: Speck converts serotonin to N-acetylserotonin as part of the melatonin biosynthesis pathway in Drosophila.
